item.title: Death Howl for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch launches February 19, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

PC version due out on December 9.

Following its December 9 launch for PC via Steam, Soulslike deckbuilder Death Howl will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch on February 19, 2026, publisher 11 bit studios and developer The Outer Zone announced. It will also be made available via Game Pass on the same day.

Here is an overview of the game, via 11 bit studios:

Blending beloved mechanics into something entirely its own, Death Howl is a genre-defying Soulslike deckbuilder that tells the story of Ro, a mother from a shamanic tribe, who refuses to accept the loss of her child. In a desperate act, she descends into the spirit world to fight for a second chance.

Minimalist in presentation but unafraid of raw, harrowing themes, Death Howl unfolds as a metaphorical journey through sorrow, survival and acceptance. It’s a hunt where every step forward carries a cost—and every enemy demands a study worthy of a huntress.

True to soulslike tropes, defeat is not the end, but part of the learning path. Resting revives fallen foes, and understanding enemy behavior is crucial to progress. Death Howl enhances this structure with tactical, grid-based combat, deck-building systems, and action-RPG exploration across eerie, hostile biomes.

Each region introduces not just new enemies and active and passive abilities, but also new cards that offer deck-tailoring possibilities, allowing players to shape their tactical approach as they progress. Every fallen spirit adds to Ro’s strength in this quiet war of grief and resolve.

Will Ro reclaim what was taken from her? Or will the spirit world take her too?

Watch a new set of trailers below.

PC Launch Trailer

11 Facts Trailer

item.title: The Alters free major content update now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

New systems, customization options, and requested features.

11 bit studios has released a free major content update for The Alters, which adds new systems, customization options, and player-requested features to the game. Downloadable content is due out in 2026.

New content in today’s update includes:

  • Gamer’s Den – Because even a stranded workforce of Jans needs somewhere to unwind.
  • Fully Playable Card Game – Challenge your other selves to something not involving existential dread.
  • Custom Base Skins – Dress your digs the way you want.
  • Custom Spacesuit Skins – Style points matter. Even on a dying star.
  • Photo Mode – Capture your best (or worst) Jan moments.
  • Relax Mode – For when you want the story without the stress.
  • A New Save System – More control over your branching decisions.
  • A New Noir-Styled Storyline – A shadowy mystery only a Jan could solve. Or complicate. Or both.

The Alters is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG.

Watch a new trailer below.

Free Major Content Update Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/the-alters-free-major-content-update-now-available

item.title: Calamity Angels: Special Delivery coming to PC in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Closed beta test registration now available.

Idea Factory International will release delivery service RPG Calamity Angels: Special Delivery for PC via Steam in 2026, the company announced. It will support English, Japanese, Simplified Chinese, and Traditional Chinese language options. A closed beta test will be held from December 22, 2025 to January 16, 2026. Registration is available now.

Calamity Angels: Special Delivery will launch first for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on February 17, 2026 in the west. It originally launched for the same platforms on June 26, 2025 in Japan.

Here is an overview of the game, via Idea Factory International:

About

Lead a rag-tag group of kooky carriers in this delivery service RPG as they protect and trek packages through treacherous terrains, unruly monsters, and meet other sneaky delivery service teams ready to stake their claim as the best delivery service in the Orkotris Region!

A new adventure awaits with every package!

Key Features

  • In the Mood for Battle? – Running a tip-top delivery service means mailing out orders AND keeping your crew in check. Watch their moods—if they’re unhappy, they might ignore your commands, but their negligence could deliver positive surprises and even victories in battle!
  • Out for Delivery! – Head to the Bulletin Board and see what deliveries await! Inspect the parcel, pack it tightly (no gaps allowed!), and assemble your crew with the right gear (to bonk any pesky foes) and tools for a smooth drop-off. Each successful drop-off delivers sweet rewards your way, so handle with care!
  • Delivery in Three-to-Five Business Days (Unless you Run into a Boss) – Start your adventure with a roulette spin to determine your next move. Land on shop spaces for goodies, collect special packages for rewards, and maybe tackle some sneaky bosses along the way!
  • Kei Nanameda… Delivers! – From the character designer of Mary Skelter and Death end re;Quest, Kei Nanameda presents a fresh delivery service world with lively dialogue, intense battles, and a quirky cast full of energy!

View the first screenshots of the PC version at the gallery.

Screenshots

  • ❯
